description: Ms. codex. Title from inscription on the pastedown of the upper cover. Physical description: 17 lines per page. Written in medium small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Thin laid paper ; frame-ruled. Stained with water ; insect damage. Chiefly quaternions ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Origin: The copy is not dated. The paper and the script suggest the 19th cent. Incipit: يا فتاح رب يسر وتمم بالخير بسم ... شكر وسپاس مر خالقي را كه در خلقت انساني دقايق حكمت او بي پايانست Explicit: با عسل بر ذكر طلا كنند همين عمل كند والله اعلم بالصواب تمام شد
author: Manṣūr ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, active 14th century
abstract: Treatise on medicine in two parts (see description of contents in the preamble of the text, fol. 3a-4b), also known as "Kifāyah-i Manṣūrī". The text is dedicated to Sulṭān Mujāhid al-Dīn Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn, i.e. Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn al-Muẓẓafarī, ruler of Fars, 786-789/1384-1387, according to the Mashhad catalogue. Rieu suggests that the dedicatee is rather Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn of Kashmīr, 823-875/1420-1470. There is no evidence however that the laqab of the latter is Mujāhid al-Dīn (Storey, C. Persian Literature).
extent: 171 leaves : paper ; 222 x 158 (165 x 115) mm. bound to 228 x 165 mm.
title: Kifāyah-i mujāhadah dar ṭibb
creator: منصور بن محمد بن احمد
subject: Medicine, Persian—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Half bound in paper and purple cloth.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
